item.title: Fiona add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"the writing of some men is like a vast bridge that carries you over the many things that claw and tear.
The Wine of Forever" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Fiona add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "You have wakened not out of sleep, but into a prior dream, and that dream lies within another, and so on, to infinity, which is the number of grains of sand. The path that you are to take is endless, and you will die before you have truly awakened." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. "Can they be brought together?" This is a practical question. We must get down to it. "I despise intelligence" really means: "I cannot bear my doubts." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "The purpose of a writer is to keep civilization from destroying itself." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Herman Wouk
item.description: "Peace, if it ever exists, will not be based on the fear of war, but on the love of peace. It will not be the abstaining from an act, but the coming of a state of mind." -- Herman Wouk

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Herman Wouk
item.description: "Income tax returns are the most imaginative fiction being written today." -- Herman Wouk

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Trenton Lee Stewart
item.description: "Oh, here’s a clever one. Do you remember this question from the first test? It reads, ‘What’s wrong with this statement?’ And do you know what Constance wrote in reply? She wrote, ‘What’s wrong with you?" -- Trenton Lee Stewart

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "Always be a poet, even in prose." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Fiona add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I don't want to repeat my innocence. I want the pleasure of losing it again." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Fiona add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Things are sweeter when they're lost. I know--because once I wanted something and got it. It was the only thing I ever wanted badly, Dot, and when I got it it turned to dust in my hand." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "My entire soul is a cry, and all my work is a commentary on that cry." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description:
"Tell me what you do with the food you eat, and I'll tell you who you are. Some turn their food into fat and manure, some into work and good humor, and others, I'm told, into God. So there must be three sorts of men. I'm not one of the worst, boss, nor yet one of the best. I'm somewhere in between the two. What I eat I turn into work and good humor. That's not too bad, after all!'
He looked at me wickedly and started laughing.
'As for you, boss,' he said, 'I think you do your level best to turn what you eat into God. But you can't quite manage it, and that torments you. The same thing's happening to you as happened to the crow.'
'What happened to the crow, Zorba?'
'Well, you see, he used to walk respectably, properly - well, like a crow. But one day he got it into his head to try and strut about like a pigeon. And from that time on the poor fellow couldn't for the life of him recall his own way of walking. He was all mixed up, don't you see? He just hobbled about." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "Only one woman exists in this world, one woman with countless faces." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "For those who believe in God, most of the big questions are answered. But for those of us who can't readily accept the God formula, the big answers don't remain stone-written. We adjust to new conditions and discoveries. We are pliable. Love need not be a command nor faith a dictum. I am my own god. We are here to unlearn the teachings of the church, state, and our educational system. We are here to drink beer. We are here to kill war. We are here to laugh at the odds and live our lives so well that Death will tremble to take us." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Fiona add a quote by Nicholas Christopher
item.description: "It was Calzas who told me that your life is a road along which you leave many markers-points in time and places on the map.The ones in time you can only revisit in your mind, and they never change. The places can be revisited firsthand, but they're constantly changing. To keep a place the same , he said, you can no longer return to it-and then it becomes a point in time." -- Nicholas Christopher
